intro: Sinapis setigera, commonly known as the hairy mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known mustard plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems covered in fine hairs. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom from April to June. The leaves are alternate, lobed, and often have a distinctive hairy texture, contributing to its common name.
